title: Man killed in apparent shooting outside liquor store on city's north side
content:
FLINT, MI - A man was shot and killed early Friday morning outside a liquor store on the city's north side.
Police were called to 2310 Martin Luther King Ave. at 12:36 a.m., Aug. 5 for reports of a shooting, according to Flint police Lt. Jason Cate.
When officers arrived they found a man in his 20s dead in the parking lot of the Liquor Plus Mini Mart having suffered multiple gunshot wounds, police said.
Cate said there was some sort of altercation before the shooting.
Last week a 10-year-old boy was shot in the same area following a fight between adults. Police responded to the area of East Dayton Street and MLK Avenue about 4:25 a.m. on July 29 and found the boy. He was taken to the hospital in good condition.
"From what we know, we do not believe (Friday's shooting) is related to the 10-year-old," Cate said.
Anyone with additional information on the shooting is asked to call call Crime Stoppers at 1-800-422-JAIL.
A 10-year-old boy was sent to the hospital early Friday morning following a shooting on Flint's north side.
